tasks.task: Construct and maintain a rainwater collection system.
subtasks: Install gutter devices at each corner of the home to trap large particles.
Redirect water from gutters into a four-inch PVC pipe.
Apply paint to the PVC pipe to protect it from UV radiation and deterioration.
Connect PVC pipes from front and back gutters to a central water trap.
Use adapters and floating balls to create a device that captures initial runoff and allows clean water to pass.
Integrate a clean-out valve at the bottom of the water trap for maintenance.
Transfer collected water into a 375-gallon tote, ensuring UV protection and food-grade material.
Filter larger particles with a screen at the bottom of the tote.
Apply black paint to the tote to prevent algae growth.
Securely mount the tote on a slope with a properly leveled foundation.
Install a valve with a ball closure to enable easy access for water collection.
Use adapters to convert the tote's unique thread to standard pipe threads for attaching PVC pipes.
Set up similar systems at other corners of the property to increase water collection.
Screen and filter water further with a pre-filter (e.g., cheesecloth) before passing through a gravity-fed ceramic filter.

tasks.task: Maintain filtration process for collect rainwater.
subtasks: Periodically clean the pre-filter to prevent clogging of the main filter.
Inspect and maintain the floating ball mechanism to ensure proper operation.
Regularly clean the water traps and totes to prevent bacterial growth.
Check the integrity of the PVC pipes and adapters for any leaks or damage.
Test the water valve and ball closure for functionality and security.
Monitor the performance of the ceramic filter and replace or clean as needed.

tasks.task: Utilize collected rainwater for gardening and potential domestic use.
subtasks: Distribute collected water through a watering system such as soaker hoses.
Store excess water in the totes until needed for irrigation.
Schedule regular watering cycles based on plant needs and rainfall events.
Monitor water levels in the totes and replenish as necessary.
Consider an alternate use for excess water if needed, such as for livestock or washing.
